intro: Scolymocephalus glaber, commonly known as the smooth scolymus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is native to southern Europe and is often found in dry, rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
